header.title: Transcendental Satanism: Doctrines of the Infernal Process

central_thesis: Transcendental Satanism posits a radical, individualistic path to spiritual evolution and self-deification, termed the 'Infernal Process'. This process cultivates a 'Defined Form' of consciousness capable of existing beyond death, achieved through the disciplined gratification of all desires, the rejection of external morality, and the constant development of personal will and power. The system is guided by the 'Satanic Aspect' – a splintered portion of one's own consciousness – and seeks to oppose the 'natural universe' and the static 'God' to foster unique self-created existence.

structure_content.summary: Stanton LaVey introduces the work, highlighting its unique approach to Satanism, emphasizing self-actualization and personal enlightenment as a path for the future of the Satanic.

The author recounts a personal history of altered perception, hallucinogenic experiences, and a profound vision of Satan's metamorphosis. This leads to an 'unconscious pact' for spiritual evolution, setting the stage for a system that perceives Hell as a separation from God, leading to spiritual evolution rather than damnation.

The book's words are presented as the 'Word of Transcendental Satanism,' codifying the 'infernal process' as a religion of spiritual evolution. It introduces the 'Satanic Aspect' as a metaphysical, splintered portion of the self, to be reconnected through this process, fostering a unique understanding of existence.

structure_content.chapter_title: Chapter 2: Fifteen Statements of Transcendental Satanism
structure_content.summary: Outlines fifteen foundational principles for adherents, including never denying lust, respecting and following desire, living without regret, relinquishing given morality, using fear as a guide, striving for advancement of mind and body, dying rather than failing, rejecting illusions, living through action, developing conscious discipline, taking responsibility, being aware of Satanic Aspect signs, seeking all forms of power, renouncing rigid existence, and completing all that is begun.

structure_content.chapter_title: Chapter 3: Fifteen Statements of the OTS: Part Two
structure_content.summary: Provides detailed commentary on the fifteen statements, emphasizing themes such as lust as a powerful force (stronger than God's will), desire as a path to consciousness, regret as a detrimental energy drain, the learned and arbitrary nature of morality, fear as a guide to action, the necessity of continuous mind/body development, and the importance of self-responsibility and conscious action over passive existence.

Lists the eight core beliefs of Transcendental Satanism: the power of will, gratification of all desire for consciousness, figurative/literal death of opposition, spiritual evolution of self, the Absent Dimension, the Defined Form beyond death, the Six Gateways, and the Satanic Aspect.

structure_content.chapter_title: Chapter 5: Eight Standard Beliefs: Part Two
structure_content.summary: Expands on the eight standard beliefs, detailing the paramount importance of personal will in shaping reality, the necessity of desire gratification for consciousness, the adversarial stance against those who oppose one's will, the concept of spiritual evolution, the 'Absent Dimension' as the source of all manifestations, the 'Defined Form' as the post-death self, the 'Six Gateways' as paths to power, and the 'Satanic Aspect' as an internal guide.

Presents eight principles for contemplation, including the inherent inequality of individuals, the importance of exploring one's 'darkest nature,' unwavering belief in the 'Word,' rejecting contradictory thoughts, embracing suffering for strength, developing imagination for death and power, understanding darkness as a necessity, and accepting violence as a means to understanding.

structure_content.chapter_title: Chapter 7: Eight Points of Contemplation: Part Two
structure_content.summary: Offers commentary on the eight points of contemplation, reinforcing the inherent inequality of humans, advocating for the full realization of the self (including its darkest aspects), stressing the necessity of adherence to the 'Word' to dismantle old programming, promoting radical acceptance of suffering as a source of strength, highlighting imagination's role in navigating death, and rationalizing violence as a last resort for understanding when other means fail.

The Great Satan is described as an entity from the 'unknown realm' whose primary concern is the creation of consciousness. He granted humankind the potential for rebellion against the 'natural universe' and the ability to escape annihilation upon death. He is unconcerned with individual prayers or mundane problems, perceiving existence solely as energy.

structure_content.chapter_title: Chapter 11: The Satanic Aspect and Suggested Fate
structure_content.summary: The 'Satanic Aspect' is an inherent, splintered portion of one's consciousness, acting as a guide (via divination and energetic resonance) for personal development and the cultivation of a refined self. This guidance, termed 'suggested fate,' leads to optimal consciousness development. While free will allows for other paths, the practitioner must accept the energetic repercussions and responsibility for choices outside the suggested fate.

God is depicted as a static force promoting conformity and stasis, aiming to eradicate consciousness by ensuring the 'natural' continuation of the world. He is uninfluenced by prayer, and human desires that disrupt the objective universe are irrelevant to His plan. The continuous suffering in the world serves as evidence of God's indifference.

The 'implanted mind' refers to thoughts and beliefs originating from external societal influences (parenting, advertising, tradition) rather than the self. This external programming subjugates consciousness. The text advocates for eradicating internal dialogue and pursuing 'non-thought' to access the true self and authentic desires, asserting that uncontrolled thoughts define an individual.

Morality is presented as a learned, arbitrary construct rather than an inherent truth. The text argues that concepts of good and evil are subjective interpretations of behavior. It is imperative to destroy all preconceived notions of morality to facilitate self-creation, and an amoral life is recommended for OTS members to pursue consciousness without hindrance from moral dilemmas.

structure_content.chapter_title: Chapter 15: The Idea of Opposition and Rebellion
structure_content.summary: Opposition and rebellion against the 'natural universe' and irrational societal norms are fundamental for individual self-creation and liberation. Defiant actions, including body modification and rejecting trends, foster independence. Membership in OTS and adherence to its 'Word' are inherently rebellious acts, aiming to establish a new 'evil' in the world.

Emotions are seen as tools for manipulation; practitioners must discipline themselves not to be swayed by them. The goal is to consciously control emotions, purposely experiencing difficult ones to gain power over feelings. Eradicating all past emotional remnants is crucial to live in the present and maintain full consciousness.

Humans are described as 'biological machines' whose free will is dulled by social conditioning, making their actions predictable. Relationships are based on roles rather than inherent 'truth,' with statements being 'fraudulent' and exposed by time. Therefore, honesty is only advocated for the self; truth in external interactions is ephemeral and can be used for manipulation.

structure_content.chapter_title: Chapter 18: The Beauty of a Lie
structure_content.summary: Honesty is deemed counterproductive for relationships and personal freedom. Lies serve to maintain secrecy, protect from discrimination, and fulfill others' emotional needs (as people want to be told comforting 'lies'). Unforgiving honesty is reserved exclusively for introspection to facilitate self-development and evolution.

Engaging in arguments is considered a pointless expenditure of energy, as people are unwilling to accept foreign ideas and will quickly rationalize their own positions. True power lies in gaining dominance over one's own uncontrolled self, rather than seeking 'pseudo dominance' in external disputes.

The 'infernal process' is a solitary path for a select few, as mass spiritual evolution is impossible due to the 'natural universe' (God) inhibiting it. Attempts to 'awaken' the masses are futile and drain precious energy needed for personal development. Practitioners are advised to let others 'sleep' in their conditioned state.

Self-preservation is paramount, as others will invariably fail to provide support in crucial moments. This understanding is essential for removing the illusion of a 'human safety net.' Philanthropic acts are only acceptable if they cause absolutely no detriment (financial, physical, mental) to the self, as weakness invites exploitation.

structure_content.chapter_title: Chapter 22: The Problem with Personal History
structure_content.summary: Past personal history, especially with the advent of the internet, can grant others power and impede an individual's transformation. To advance, one must sever ties with those who cling to outdated perceptions of the self. Guarding personal history and removing unsupportive individuals is crucial for continuous self-creation.

Traditional religions impose restrictive rules, yet their adherents frequently break them, relying on 'God's forgiveness' to alleviate guilt. This constant forgiveness is seen as irresponsible, preventing true change. Satan offers absolute freedom from such rules, asserting that all experiences, conscious acts, and desires contribute to unique forms of consciousness and personal power.

Most individuals fit into predictable 'molds' dictated by societal influences, limiting their self-perception. A 'true eclectic' consciously synthesizes seemingly contradictory ideas and styles from diverse sources, creating a unique identity that defies social categorization. This practice fosters liberation and constantly redefines reality through individual existence.

Individuals construct belief structures to interpret reality, protecting core beliefs even if illogical. To achieve higher consciousness, it is necessary to actively accept ideas that challenge and ultimately dismantle one's established belief structure, thereby creating a 'new world' of understanding.

Language, though used to convey intellectual and emotional meaning, is inherently limited in its ability to accurately describe esoteric energy, power, consciousness, and profound spiritual experiences. Western traditions lack the vocabulary to portray higher levels of experience, which often contradict logic when expressed verbally.

All existence is energy; the 'energy body' (extending beyond the physical form) perceives and absorbs it. The goal is to identify and assimilate beneficial energy while rejecting detrimental forms, particularly the 'toxic' energy of most people. Accumulating personal power is crucial for maintaining self-created consciousness and achieving health, vitality, and focus.

Personalized energy persists beyond death as 'energetic strands,' formed by intense passions. Unlike delusional beliefs in divine afterlives, connecting with these strands through identified passionate beliefs keeps the essence of the deceased alive. This process imbues new energy into the strand, renewing its existence within one's own passion.

Satanic Yoga is a practice leveraging the mind-body connection through specific postures (asanas). It aims to unlock hidden energy, release negative forces, strengthen will, and improve concentration. By mastering uncomfortable positions, one overcomes life's challenges, leading to 'unbelievable power' and freedom from physical and emotional crippling, fostering mental growth.

Psychiatry, by prescribing mind-altering drugs, treats the physical body with disrespect, fostering dependency and ultimately destroying consciousness. This is contrasted with Satanic Yoga, which provides a path to physical and psychological balance through self-discipline, without resorting to foreign substances that cripple the individual and integrate them into societal norms.

Dark Angels are not conventional celestial beings but flawed humans imbued with a direct connection to the Great Satan's immense energy. This intense energy compels them to destructive behaviors but also grants them power to inspire and subtly guide others. Their beliefs, sealed in death, provide a continuous 'line of power' for those they deemed worthy.

Death is the 'most significant battle' for the soul. Upon physical demise, consciousness must race to reconnect with the Satanic Aspect to reclaim its splintered power and prevent absorption into the 'natural universe' (God), which would lead to the loss of individual identity. The 'Defined Form' and 'Self-Created Gateway' are essential for this 'Other Way' to the unknown.

structure_content.chapter_title: Chapter 33: The Symbols of Transcendental Satanism
structure_content.summary: Symbols are potent tools possessing power, intrigue, and meaning. They are used to create emotional reactions, reinforce desires, and represent strength, direction, or attainment. In Transcendental Satanism, symbols represent stages of individual development within the infernal process, acting as keys to power and guidance.

Provides detailed explanations for seven core symbols: Rebirth (separation from masses), Second Awareness (ascension above masses), Synthesized Cultivation (development of body, desires, mind, will), Self-Creation (rebellion against man's conception of time), Focused Will (intentions for unknown and objective world), Acquired Power (mastery of breathing, flexibility, strength), and Lord (overall infernal process and its levels of existence).

Introduces the 'Six Gateways' (Pain, Pleasure, Creation, Dreams, Abstinence, Synthesis) as passages into alternative dimensions to gather power and energy for consciousness advancement. Accessing them requires significant 'stored energy' and specific experiences related to each gateway's nature, described as 'entry paths' that lead to a dualistic state of awareness.

structure_content.chapter_title: Chapter 36: The Six Gateways: Part Two
structure_content.summary: Explains the practical techniques and associated sigils for accessing the gateways. It cautions about the careful use and replication of sigils, and emphasizes 'entry paths' as a gradual adjustment to dualistic awareness, warning against forceful attempts that could lead to 'spiritual shock.'

Access requires lucid dreaming, achieved through practices like 'time checking' in waking life to carry into dreams. Once lucid, the practitioner stares at their hands, learns to fly, and then flies straight up through a thick blackness to break through a 'pitch-black glass ceiling' into the Gateway of Dreams. Gained dream abilities are said to have counterpart abilities in waking consciousness.

This gateway requires immense discipline, particularly for males. The technique involves self-arousal, repeatedly pushing to the 'edge of climax' and then backing down (six times), interspersed with deep breaths. After the sixth near-climax, the practitioner allows orgasm, holding onto the sensations and moving 'inside what is being felt' to enter the gateway.

Accessed through creative processes like writing, music, or painting. The described technique involves deep breathing, envisioning the sigil, and then writing 'what occurs with my energy body' as a record of experiences from the gateway. The writing itself creates a 'parallel entry path' and the words manifest the experience rather than describing it.

The most expeditious way to access this gateway is through eradicating internal dialogue (absence of thought). Other practices include fasting, sleep deprivation, and sexual abstinence. The core technique involves a three-step cycle of breath focus, visualizing the infernal process symbol, and internally repeating 'I,' repeated until pure internal silence and a sensation of expansion are achieved.

A difficult and dangerous gateway that can cause permanent physical damage. The practice involves choosing a type of pain that maximizes sensation with minimal physical harm (e.g., prolonged stretching or body suspensions). The practitioner must endure the pain, cease resistance, 'imagine sinking into the pain,' and 'chase the pain within the mind' to enter the gateway.

Accessed by combining or synthesizing practices and ideas from the other gateways, especially seemingly opposing ones (e.g., pain and pleasure, as explored in sadomasochistic techniques). This process yields unique forms of consciousness, energy, and power, drastically altering the self through the experience of combining diverse elements.

structure_content.chapter_title: Chapter 43: Concept of the Circle of Creation
structure_content.summary: Subjective mental expressions must be manifested into the objective world and subjected to public scrutiny to evolve. This practice, viewed as fundamental, increases the influence and power of will. Creations consumed by others and their interpretations are returned for self-consumption, refining creative ability and gauging the power used in self-creation.

structure_content.chapter_title: Chapter 44: The Magic of the Outer Orgasm
structure_content.summary: This chapter defines magic as conforming objective and subjective reality to one's will, and sorcery as manipulating language/matter for desired effects. The ritual involves creating a separated environment, suspending rational thought, invoking the Satanic Aspect, intensely focusing emotions on a desired goal, creating and burning an abstract symbol, and then channeling sexual energy (lust) during orgasm to project the symbol's power into the objective world.

The 'Law of Attraction' is re-framed as 'black magic' or 'The Creation of Will Manifested.' It's presented as an amoral, self-serving process where strong will can manifest desires regardless of means, often with severe consequences (e.g., paralysis for a million dollars). Success depends on cultivated internal energy, and the practice is dangerous due to its capacity to bypass current reality.

A seven-level process designed to propel consciousness to heightened states. It involves working with personal desires and OTS concepts to culminate in the creation of a 'secret symbol' and the 'Self-Created Gateway,' which serves as a portal to the unknown upon death, preventing the dissipation of consciousness into the natural universe.

structure_content.chapter_title: Chapter 47: The Seven Levels of the Infernal Initiation Explained
structure_content.summary: Details each of the seven levels: 1. Rebirth (information gathering/discussion); 2. Second Awareness (manifesting the 'Word' physically); 3. Synthesized Cultivation (combining OTS with personal predilections); 4. Self-Creation (developing a unique creation for public consumption); 5. Focused Will (engaging society with the creation, using magic); 6. Acquired Power (physical tuning, extreme mental/physical acts); 7. Lord (self-created secret symbol for post-death passage, based on societal impact of unique creation).

Emphasizes the importance of acknowledging and showing gratitude to all who have influenced one's existence, regardless of their intent. Denying these 'debts' leads to personal destruction. For the deceased, their essence should be kept alive through memory and action, continuously emitting appreciation to their energetic strands for eternity.

key_concepts.definition: A personalized religion and philosophy centered on individual spiritual evolution, self-creation, and the cultivation of personal power through an 'infernal process,' in direct opposition to the natural universe and traditional concepts of God. It values conscious will, desire gratification, and the rejection of external morality and societal norms.

The rigorous path of spiritual evolution within Transcendental Satanism, demanding complete devotion and faith. Its goal is to achieve true self-change and ultimately manifest a 'Defined Form' of consciousness that can persist beyond physical death and resist absorption into the undifferentiated natural universe or God.

A metaphysical, splintered portion of an individual's consciousness, imbued by the Great Satan at conception. It functions as an internal guide, providing direction through divination (signs) and energetic resonance (alignment with true will) to cultivate consciousness and facilitate personal development.

An entity originating from the 'unknown realm,' whose primary will is to generate more consciousness in the universe. He endowed humankind with the potential for rebellion against the natural order and the means to escape annihilation upon death. The Great Satan is an immense energy, unconcerned with individual prayers or mundane human issues.

The ultimate created self, attained through the continuous acquisition of consciousness by consciously gratifying desire. This 'new self' is powerful and refined enough to exist beyond the physical body and successfully transition into the unknown realm upon death without dissolving into the universal consciousness.

A primordial dimension that exists prior to the subjective mind and is devoid of all conceivable things. It is the source from which all new dimensions and inconceivable manifestations are drawn as raw energy, with its vibrations becoming comprehensible only when brought into the subjective mind.

Passages into other distinct realms of existence (Pain, Pleasure, Creation, Dreams, Abstinence, Synthesis) where practitioners can gather unique forms of power and energy. Each gateway provides specific opportunities for the advancement of consciousness and internal strength, accessed through disciplined practices related to its inherent nature.

A system of physical postures (asanas) and breathwork designed to manipulate the body's energy flow. Its purpose is to unlock hidden power, release negative forces, strengthen the will, improve concentration, and achieve a holistic balance between the physical and mental aspects of existence, leading to spiritual growth and freedom from 'emotional crippling.'

key_concepts.term: Magic of the Outer Orgasm / Sorcery
key_concepts.definition: A form of black magic used to influence objective and subjective reality. Sorcery involves the manipulation of language and matter to manifest desired effects. The 'Magic of the Outer Orgasm' is a ritualistic practice that utilizes intense emotional charge, focused will, and sexual energy (specifically during orgasm) to project a self-created symbol's power into the objective world, thus 'creating' rather than 'attracting' desired outcomes.

The collective sum of forced teachings and external influences (e.g., parenting, advertising, societal norms, tradition) that dominate most individuals' subjective states and internal dialogue. It is seen as a source of subjugation, limiting self-creation and perpetuating a false sense of reality. Overcoming it requires eradicating internal dialogue and pursuing 'non-thought' to access the true self.

A personal portal formed through the culmination of the 'Infernal Initiation' and the creation of a 'secret symbol.' This gateway is intended to tear open the fabric of the natural universe upon death, allowing the individual's 'Defined Form' to pass into the unknown realm, thereby preserving consciousness and preventing its dissolution into God or the natural universe.

practical_system.description: The practical system of Transcendental Satanism is an operative methodology for individual spiritual evolution, aimed at cultivating a 'Defined Form' of consciousness capable of independent existence beyond death. This 'Infernal Process' is guided by the 'Satanic Aspect' (an internal conscious fragment) and emphasizes conscious will, the gratification of all desires, and the systematic rejection of external morality and societal conditioning. Practices involve energetic manipulation, altering states of consciousness, and ritualistic acts to accumulate power, expand awareness, and manifest personal will within both subjective and objective realms.
tools: Sigils (specific symbols for each Gateway and a self-created 'secret symbol' for the 'Lord' level of initiation)
Creative materials (for Gateway of Creation, e.g., art supplies)
The practitioner's own physical body (for Satanic Yoga, Gateway of Pain, Gateway of Pleasure)
A conducive ritual environment designed to foster emotional intensity and separation from the mundane.
rituals: Accessing the Six Gateways (Dreams, Pleasure, Creation, Abstinence, Pain, Synthesis): Each gateway has specific 'entry paths' involving various sensory, mental, and physical disciplines (e.g., lucid dreaming techniques for Dreams, repeated near-orgasms for Pleasure, focused writing for Creation, eradication of internal dialogue for Abstinence, enduring self-inflicted pain for Pain, and combining elements from other gateways for Synthesis). The goal is to shift awareness to the 'energy body' and gather unique forms of energy from other dimensions.

Magic of the Outer Orgasm (Sorcery): A ritualistic practice for manifesting will in the objective world. It involves creating a separated ritual space, suspending rational thought, invoking the Satanic Aspect, intensely focusing on a desired goal to cultivate emotional energy, creating an abstract sigil representing this feeling, burning the sigil to transmute it into the subjective realm, then cultivating sexual energy to peak arousal, and during orgasm, envisioning the sigil to project power towards the desired outcome.

The Seven Levels of the Infernal Initiation: A progressive system for developing consciousness and will. Levels involve discussing OTS concepts ('Rebirth'), manifesting them physically ('Second Awareness'), synthesizing personal desires with OTS principles ('Synthesized Cultivation'), preparing unique creations for public display ('Self-Creation'), engaging society with these creations using magic ('Focused Will'), achieving physical mastery and extreme mental/physical feats ('Acquired Power'), and ultimately creating a 'secret symbol' for post-death passage ('Lord').

relevant_quotes.text: The words of this book represent the Word of Transcendental Satanism.

Die rather than fail or submit.
Reject illusions created by words.
Seek all forms of power.
Complete all that is begun.

Morality is not inherent. The people that surround a person in their formative years of psychological development give it to them.
Fear is desire’s shadow. When the path of desire is unclear, use fear as a guide to find what should be actively pursued.
People are not created equal.
Rejoice in all things, especially situations that lead to suffering because suffering is the greatest gift that yields strength.
Violence is sometimes required for understanding.
The Great Satan is only concerned with creating more consciousness in the universe. This is his will.
Prayer or pleading of any kind to the Great Satan is useless. He is unconcerned with individual pursuits or problems because he does not see things in such mundane fashion.
God is an impending force, which pushes the agenda of conformity to dull and eradicate consciousness.
It is dangerous listening to the constant internal conversation of the self because the majority of what is being reviewed or entertained is not of self-creation but that of the implanted mind.
Honesty is not the best policy. Despite the continual pleading for the truth, there are very few circumstances that the truth should be told in its entirety.
Arguing with anyone is a pointless endeavor.
Mankind cannot be saved. The evolution of the self is a personally motivated act only meant for a few individuals.
In matters of survival and well-being, the self should be considered before all others.
Everything is energy. Everything emanates its own unique energy.
Death is the most significant battle ever encountered just outside of life.
The use of magic in the infernal process is a way to gain the experience of being a god rather than being in submission to a god.
The Law of Attraction is actually the use of black magic. It should really be called “The Creation of Will Manifested.”
Winning or losing doesn’t matter. Live for the fight.

critical_analysis.relevance: Transcendental Satanism presents a highly idiosyncratic and radical interpretation of Satanism, distinguishing itself from both LaVeyan philosophical Satanism (though acknowledging LaVey's son in the foreword) and traditional theistic Satanism. Its emphasis on individual spiritual evolution, self-deification, and the cultivation of personal 'power' through energetic manipulation and altered states aligns it with certain currents in Chaos Magic and modern left-hand path esotericism, particularly its focus on will-based creation and the rejection of external moral frameworks. The text's unique cosmology, positing a 'Great Satan' as a source of consciousness and rebellion against a static 'God,' offers a distinct adversarial framework. Its practical methodology, integrating physical, mental, and magical techniques, positions it as a 'grimoire' for radical self-transformation, with an explicit antinomian stance against societal and religious conditioning.
critical_analysis.target_audience: This work targets advanced practitioners of Western Esotericism and Occultism who are interested in self-deification, adversarial paths, and intense personal transformation. It is for individuals seeking complete liberation from conventional societal and religious programming, willing to embrace discomfort, challenge all external authorities, and take absolute responsibility for their 'self-created' existence. The author's explicit warning to 'sane' individuals not to follow the practices underscores its niche appeal to those committed to extreme and potentially dangerous forms of magical and spiritual work.
